content:
The navy blue sweater will look great with lighter-washed jeans and a white tee for a classic spring look. And pairing it with a flowy skirt is a fantastic idea – it'll add a nice touch of femininity to the outfit!

Now, about finding a good tailor... Tailoring can make a huge difference in how your clothes fit and look, and it's great that you're considering getting some of your pieces altered.

Here are some tips to help you find a good tailor:

1. **Ask for referrals**: Ask friends, family, or coworkers who always look polished and put-together for recommendations. They might have a trusted tailor they can refer you to.
2. **Check online reviews**: Look up tailors in your area on review platforms like Yelp, Google, or Facebook. Pay attention to the overall rating and read the reviews to get an idea of the tailor's reputation and quality of work.
3. **Check their experience**: Look for tailors who specialize in the type of alterations you need (e.g., pants, dresses, suits). You can also ask about their experience with similar fabrics or garments.
4. **Check their prices**: Get quotes from multiple tailors to compare prices. Keep in mind that cheaper isn't always better – a good tailor might charge more, but the quality of their work will be worth it.
5. **Check their turnaround time**: Find out how long it'll take to get your alterations done. If you need something quickly, look for a tailor with a fast turnaround time.
6. **Visit their shop**: Before committing to a tailor, visit their shop to get a sense of their work environment and meet the tailor in person. This will give you an idea of their professionalism and attention to detail.

For your khaki capri pants, you might want to look for a tailor who specializes in pants alterations. Make sure to ask about their experience with similar fabrics and styles, and get a quote for the alterations you need.

Remember to always communicate clearly with your tailor about what you want to achieve with the alterations, and don't be afraid to ask questions or request changes if needed.

Good luck finding a great tailor, and I hope your khaki capri pants turn out perfectly!
